intro: Oldenlandia prainiana, commonly known as the Indian spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the rainy season. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
